data.enText: -oes

data.chText: 回响；回声；回音
data.enText: the reflecting of sound off a wall or inside a confined space so that a noise appears to be repeated; a sound that is reflected back in this way

data.chText: 电话里有回音，我听不清楚。
data.enText: There was an echo on the line and I couldn't hear clearly.

data.chText: 座座山丘传来微弱的回声。
data.enText: The hills sent back a faint echo.

data.chText: 沿走廊跑的脚步回声
data.enText: the echo of footsteps running down the corridor

data.chText: 映现；暗示；启示；反响
data.enText: the fact of an idea, event, etc. being like another and reminding you of it; sth that reminds you of sth else

data.chText: 昨天的撞车事故和以前的灾难令人痛心地相似。
data.enText: Yesterday's crash has grim echoes of previous disasters.

data.chText: 共鸣；附和；重复
data.enText: an opinion or attitude that agrees with or repeats one already expressed or thought

data.chText: 他的话是她多次听到过的话的重复。
data.enText: His words were an echo of what she had heard many times before.

data.chText: 这次演讲在许多听众的心中引起共鸣。
data.enText: The speech found an echo in the hearts of many of the audience (= they agreed with it) .
echoes
echoing
echoed
echoed

data.chText: 回响；回荡
data.enText: if a sound echoes , it is reflected off a wall, the side of a mountain, etc. so that you can hear it again

data.chText: 她的脚步声在空荡荡的屋子里回响着。
data.enText: Her footsteps echoed in the empty room.

data.chText: 枪炮声在林中回荡。
data.enText: The gunshot echoed through the forest.

data.chText: 发出回声；产生回响；充满回声
data.enText: to send back and repeat a sound; to be full of a sound

data.chText: 整个房子充满回声。
data.enText: The whole house echoed.

data.chText: 街上回荡着孩子的哭声。
data.enText: The street echoed with the cries of children.

data.chText: 山谷里回荡着他的声音。
data.enText: The valley echoed back his voice.

data.chText: 重复，附和（想法或看法）
data.enText: to repeat an idea or opinion because you agree with it

data.chText: 这是党内许多右翼分子都重复过的观点。
data.enText: This is a view echoed by many on the right of the party.

data.chText: （尤因感到意外而）重复…话，模仿
data.enText: to repeat what sb else has just said, especially because you find it surprising

data.chText: “他去了！”维夫重复道。
data.enText: ‘He's gone!’ Viv echoed.

example: the flower arrangement was created as an echo of a client's still life

tr: a close parallel of a feeling, idea, style, etc.
example: his contention contains more than an echo of Rousseau
Napoleon III was an echo of the mighty Emperor but an infinitely better man

tr: the repetition of a sound resulting from reflection of the sound waves
example: she could hear echoes of her own footsteps

tr: a reflected television or radio or radar beam
a reply that repeats what has just been said

example: followers echoing the cries of their leaders
His words echoed John F. Kennedy

value.def: An echo is a sound which is caused by a noise being reflected off a surface such as a wall.

example.ex: He heard nothing but the echoes of his own voice.
example.tran: 他只听见了自己的回音。

value.def: If a sound echoes, it is reflected off a surface and can be heard again after the original sound has stopped.

example.ex: His feet echoed on the bare board floor...
example.tran: 他的脚步声在没铺地毯的木地板上发出回响。

example.ex: The bang came suddenly, echoing across the buildings, shattering glass.
example.tran: 突如其来的一声巨响在建筑物间回荡着，震碎了玻璃。

value.def: In a place that echoes, a sound is reflected off a surface, and is repeated after the original sound has stopped.

example.ex: The corridor echoed with the barking of a dozen dogs.
example.tran: 十来只狗的叫声在走廊里回响。

example.ex: ...the bare stone floors and the echoing hall.
example.tran: 光秃秃的石头地面和有回音的大厅

value.def: If you echo someone's words, you repeat them or express agreement with their attitude or opinion.

example.ex: Many phrases in the last two chapters echo earlier passages...
example.tran: 最后两章中的很多说法是对前面段落的呼应。

example.ex: Their views often echo each other...
'That was a truly delicious piece of pork,' he said. 'Yes, wasn't it?' echoed Penelope.
example.tran: “那块猪肉真好吃，”他说。“没错，可不是么？”佩内洛普附和道。

value.def: An echo is an expression of an attitude, opinion, or statement which has already been expressed.

example.ex: I hear an echo of the thinking that got us into this mess in the first place...
example.tran: 我听到有人重提那个最先使我们陷入这一困境的想法。

example.ex: Political attacks work only if they find an echo with voters.
example.tran: 政治攻击只有在选民中引起共鸣才会有作用。

value.tran: （态度、观点或说法的）重复，附和

value.def: A detail or feature which reminds you of something else can be referred to as an echo .

example.ex: The accident has echoes of past disasters.
example.tran: 那起事故仿佛是过去灾难的重现。

value.def: If one thing echoes another, the first is a copy of a particular detail or feature of the other.

example.ex: Pinks and beiges were chosen to echo the colours of the ceiling.
example.tran: 选用了粉红色和米色，以跟从天花板的颜色。

value.def: If something echoes, it continues to be discussed and remains important or influential in a particular situation or among a particular group of people.

example.ex: The old fable continues to echo down the centuries.
example.tran: 这则古老的寓言流传了数个世纪。

trans: 回声抑制器；反射信号抑制器
回音公园；回声公园；同居男女
回光；光回声；光回波；回光现象
梯度回波；梯度回讯；梯度回音；梯度回声
回声测深仪(用于海洋探测)
缺陷反射波；缺陷回波；缺陷的回波信号
回声效应；回声效果；反射效应；混响效果；回波效应
回音室；回响室；回声密室；回声室；混响室
